N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 578.4 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Allowable costs
shall mean those costs incurred by a residential treatment facility for
children and youth. To be allowable, costs must be reasonable and must relate
to patient care. (b) Allowable days
shall mean the total of patient days and reserve bed days provided by a
residential treatment facility for children and youth subject to a minimum and
maximum utilization standard pursuant to section
578.13
of this Part. (c) Commissioner shall mean the Commissioner
of Mental Health. (d) Fiscal year
of a residential treatment facility for children and youth shall mean the
12-month period beginning on July 1st and ending on June 30th. (e) Medicare program shall mean the Federal
program of health insurance for the aged and disabled established by title
XVIII of the Social Security Act. (f) Patient day shall mean the unit of
measure denoting lodging provided and services rendered to one resident between
the census-taking hour on two successive days. A patient day is counted on the
day of admission, but not on the day of discharge. A patient day is counted
when a resident is admitted with the expectation of remaining overnight but is
discharged on the same day. A patient day is counted on the day a resident
returns from temporary hospitalization or leave of absence for a therapy day, but not on the day a resident departs. (g) Provider of services means the
organization which is legally responsible for the operation of a program. The
organization may be an individual, partnership, association, corporation, public agency or a psychiatric center or institute operated by the Office of

Mental Health. (h) Reserved bed day
shall mean the unit of measure between the census-taking hour on two successive
days during which a bed is reserved for a resident who is temporarily
hospitalized or is on leave of absence for a therapy day pursuant to Part 576
of this Title. A reserved bed day is counted on the day a resident departs for
a temporary hospitalization or leave of absence for a therapy day, but not on
the day a resident returns. In no event may a reserved bed day be counted on a
day for which a patient day is counted. A reserved bed day is counted on the
day telephone notification is received of circumstances requiring termination
of the bed reservation but not on any subsequent days. (i) Residential treatment facility is an
inpatient psychiatric facility which provides active treatment under the
direction of a physician for children who are under 21 years of age and is
issued an operating certificate pursuant to Part 584 of this Title. Notes
